Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Jingling \Jin"gling\, n. The act or process of producing a jingle; also, the sound itself; a chink. ``The jingling of the guinea.'' --Tennyson. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Jingle \Jin"gle\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Jingled}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Jingling}.] To cause to give a sharp metallic sound as a little bell, or as coins shaken together; to tinkle. [1913 Webster]
The bells she jingled, and the whistle blew. --Pope. [1913 Webster]
jingling adj : having a series of high-pitched ringing sounds like many small bells; "jingling sleigh bells" [syn: {jingly}]
